page.title: 06ST. PETER'S CHURCH HAMSEY
page.content: The walls of this 800 year old {Norman church}are made of hard-wearing flint with an arched doorway made of sandstone, while the roof is of tiles and slate resembling the originals. There is a large{bell tower}with some windows bricked in. The gargoyles on each side were the first drain pipe. The inside walls have been plastered with a lime wash coating and decorated with 3 large family crests. {The chancel roof is now dangerous and during high winds it vibrates causing pieces of ceiling to fall.It{will cost {Â£4,000 to repair. The church is used regularly for worship once a month as well as being a{local tourist attraction.}Recently it has also been{used for concerts. As it stands on a slight hill in the middle of flat land the church is a well-known and{popular landmark.
